{{Infobox CHL season | title = 2000â01 OPJHL season | colour = #007AC2 | colour text = #FFFFFF | league = [[Ontario Provincial Junior A Hockey League]] | league abr = OPJHL | logo = | duration = '''Regular season'''
2000-09 â 2001-02
'''Playoffs'''
2001-02 â 2001-04 | champions = [[Thornhill Rattlers]] | no of teams = 37 | commissioner = [[Bob Hooper (ice hockey)|Bob Hooper]] | prev year = [[1999â2000 OPJHL season|1999â00]] | next year = [[2001â02 OPJHL season|2001â02]] }} The '''2000â01 OPJHL [[Season (sports)|season]]''' is the [[List of OJHL seasons|8th]] season of the [[Ontario Provincial Junior A Hockey League]] (OPJHL). The thirty-seven teams of the North, South, East, and West divisions competed in a 49-game schedule. Come February, the top eight teams of each division competed for the Frank L. Buckland Trophy, the OPJHL championship. The winner of the Buckland Cup, the [[Thornhill Rattlers]], went on to win the [[Dudley Hewitt Cup]] as Central Canadian Champions. The Rattlers were not successful in winning the [[2001 Royal Bank Cup]].http://members.shaw.ca/vernonfranchise/league/cups/national_champions.html ==Changes== *Port Hope Buzzards become the [[Port Hope Predators|Port Hope Clippers]] ==Final standings==

Thornhill 2 ::'''Thornhill''' 4 - Rayside-Balfour 1 ::'''Thornhill''' 5 - Rayside-Balfour 1 ::'''Thornhill''' 6 - Rayside-Balfour 5 ::'''Rayside-Balfour''' 3 - Thornhill 2 OT ::'''Rayside-Balfour''' 4 - Thornhill 1 ::'''Thornhill''' 3 - Rayside-Balfour 2 2OT ==[[2003 Royal Bank Cup]] Championship== Hosted by [[Flin Flon Bombers]] in [[Flin Flon, Manitoba]]. The [[Thornhill Rattlers]] finished in last place.http://members.shaw.ca/vernonfranchise/league/cups/national_champions.html '''''Round Robin''''' :'''[[Camrose Kodiaks]]''' ([[AJHL]]) defeated [[Thornhill Rattlers]] 4-1 :'''[[St. Jerome Panthers]]''' ([[QJAAAHL]]) defeated [[Thornhill Rattlers]] 5-4 :'''[[Flin Flon Bombers]]''' ([[SJHL]]) defeated [[Thornhill Rattlers]] 5-2 :'''[[Weyburn Red Wings]]''' ([[SJHL]]) defeated [[Thornhill Rattlers]] 5-3 ==Scoring leaders== ''Note: GP = Games played; G = Goals; A = Assists; Pts = Points; PIM = Penalty Minutes'' {| cellpadding="0" |- align="left" style="vertical-align: top" | | {| cellpadding="1" width="450px" style="font-size: 90%; border: 1px solid gray;" |- !
